description: A nature walk in a unique geographic area.See California state parks page for details of how this lake was formedhttp://www.parks.ca.gov/?page_id=639It's one of the lowest lakes in the world, note the elevation on the attached track is all minus (it's 65 meters below sea level).It can be stinky in the area.The mud is really sticky if has rained as it had the day before we visited. It does occasionally rain in the desert.
directions: "30 miles south of Indio on Highway 111.  Located on the north shore of the Salton Sea, it is about a three hour drive from the Los Angeles or San Diego areas.  From Los Angeles, take Interstate 10 east to Indio, take 86S exit then turn left at Avenue 66, then right onto Highway 111.  Go south about 12  miles to the Salton Sea SRA Headquarters entrance.  From San Diego take Highway 78 east, then left (north) on Highway 86 .  Turn right at Avenue 66 and then right onto Highway 111.  Go south about 12 miles to the Salton Sea SRA Headquarters entrance" directly from state parks page
title: Salton Sea
